items.text: yorker on off stump, opens his bat face slightly to squeeze a single to the left of extra-cover
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: good bouncer, rising sharply over off stump and cramping Mahmudullah with the angle. Looks to hook but he's late on the shot, and the ball may have grazed the helmet through to the keeper - might explain why Junaid got excited for a moment, believing he'd edged it
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: short offcutter, comes in towards middle and off to cramp Mashrafe slightly, and he leans away from the line to dab it down to third man
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: short outside off, pulled in the air, one-bounce, to deep square leg
full on off stump, makes a bit of room and lifts this over extra-cover. The sweeper sprints to his right to mop up
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, 2 runs

items.preText: What's happened here? A bit of a break in play as Mashrafe gets a new set of gloves.
items.text: slower ball, quite full. Saw the batsman look to make room and followed him. Mashrafe gives it a big heave and misses, and the ball doesn't miss leg stump by much
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: another slower ball but this one is short. Nice sound off the bat as he pulls this, but straight to the man at deep square leg
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: another slower short ball, Mahmudullah plays a checked pull - just meets it with the bat face closed just so - down to long leg

items.preText: Three overs to go. Can these two get Bangladesh up past 250?
items.text: down the track and Junaid fires it into Mahmudullah's feet. Gets his front leg out of the way and squeezes a single out to extra-cover

nicely bowled. Sensed Mashrafe's desire to make himself room and bowled a back-of-a-length ball angling into leg stump and cramping him for room. Looked to flick, and only managed an inside-edge down to fine leg
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: bowled him! Length ball angling into off stump, and perhaps Mahmudullah was better served looking to hit down the ground. Went across the line instead - midwicket was inside the circle - and ended up missing completely. That's four for Junaid now. He's been utterly brilliant today
length ball angling into off stump, stays in the crease and defends to midwicket
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Rubel Hossain, no run

items.text: full now, angling into middle stump, clears his front leg and drives along the ground to long-on
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Rubel Hossain, 1 run

items.preText: Ahmed: "I have always been a Junaid Khan fan. Never understood why has been ignored all the time and others are given preference over him. Even nobody gave him credit he deserved for CT17 win. It was he who replaced Wahab Riaz and changed everything for Pakistan" -- Here's a stat for you: Junaid Khan now has more wickets in this game than Amir does since the Champions Trophy final.
items.text: back of a length, angling down leg. Tucked off the hip to long leg
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 leg bye

items.text: shortish, angling into leg stump and cramping Mashrafe for room - he's got to be less predictable with his initial movement - and his attempted pull rolls gently to midwicket
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: wow. For once he gets the swinging room he wants, and he takes full toll. Makes room once more, Hasan bowls back of a length on off stump, and Mashrafe absolutely clobbers it over midwicket
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, SIX runs

items.text: low full-toss on off stump, opens his bat face and steers to deep point
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: Oh dear, that's a terrible way to get run out.Length ball on off stump, looks to clear his front leg and flat-bat to long-off. The bowler moves to his left and cuts the ball off, and the batsmen still look to steal a quick single. Bit of a brain fade, and the bowler simply has to jog to the stumps and flick the bails off
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Rubel Hossain, OUT

dismissal.text: Rubel Hossain run out (Hasan Ali) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

items.preText: Seven balls to go, one wicket in hand. Mustafizur Rahman isn't much of a batsman at all.
items.text: and that's that. Back of a length slower ball on off stump, Mashrafe makes himself room as always, and goes for the big hit down the ground. The boundaries here are massive, and there's no way he's clearing that man at long-on
items.postText: Alrighty then. I'm off for a bit of a break. Sreshth will join you soon to bring you the start of the chase. Babar Munir Kha: "A balance total, both teams would be contented at the end. For Bangladesh, 239 from precarious 12-3 is satisfactory, on the other hand, Pakistan would be happy to restrict Bangladesh to 239 from a position where they were heading toward 260+." Junaid : "Hope you get published my comment in 5th attempt :) Sad to see Mushi did not get his hundred And Junaid did not get 5 wickets :(" Ashief: "All the comeback players in this tournament make their mark with great performance. First Lasith Malinga, then Jadeja and here Junaid Khan. " Junaid Khan says playing a lot of matches in the UAE has given him a good idea of how to bowl in these conditions. He's certainly bowled magnificently today on comeback. Four wickets, the pick of them his two at the start of the innings: a perfectly directed bouncer to send back Soumya Sarkar, and a jaffa to beat Liton Das's outside edge and knock back his off stump. 7.20pm Some excellent death bowling from Junaid and Hasan Ali, and Pakistan have kept their target down to 240. Bangladesh perhaps needed to play it a little smarter given they didn't have too many wickets in hand, but how late can you leave the big hits anyway? An absorbing first half to the match - three early wickets, an excellent partnership between Mushfiqur Rahim and Mohammad Mithun to bring the innings back on track, and then a fightback from the bowlers to keep the total down below 250. Let's hope the second half is just as good.
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mashrafe Mortaza, OUT

dismissal.text: Mashrafe Mortaza c Fakhar Zaman b Hasan Ali 13 (13b 0x4 1x6) SR: 100.00
